com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.expressions

Class AttributeRetrievalBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.Expression
      • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.expressions.AttributeRetrievalBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttributeDesignator, AttributeSelector

    public abstract class AttributeRetrievalBase
extends Expression
    AttributeRetrievalBase extends PolicyComponent and implements Evaluatable to serve as an abstract base class for the com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.AttributeSelector and com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.AttributeDesignator classes.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

      • getMustBePresent

        public java.lang.Boolean getMustBePresent()
        Determines if a value must be found for this AttributeRetrievalBase when it is evaluated. If true, and no value is found, an indeterminate result is returned, otherwise an empty bag is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the value of this AttributeRetrievalBase must be found, else false

      • setMustBePresent

        public void setMustBePresent(boolean b)
        Sets the flag indicating whether a value must be found for this AttributeRetrievalBase.
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean value for the flag

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Gets the StatusCode associated with this PolicyComponent.
        Returns:
        the StatusCode associated with this PolicyComponent

      • getStatusMessage

        public java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Gets the String status message associated with this PolicyComponent.
        Returns:
        the String status message associated with this PolicyComponent or null if none

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn,
             java.lang.String messageIn)
        Sets the StatusCode and String status message for this PolicyComponent. This method is mainly provided for objects that may have lazy evaluations performed on them, in which case the status is not determined until the object is actually used.
        Parameters:
        statusCodeIn - the StatusCode for this PolicyComponent
        messageIn - the String status message for this PolicyComponent

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk()
        Does a check on the StatusCode for this element to determine if it is equivalent to the OK status code.
        Returns:
        true if the StatusCode is equivalent to OK, otherwise false

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        If a StatusCode has not been set, ask this PolicyComponent to validate itself and return the value from the validation. Otherwise, check to see if the cached StatusCode indicates this PolicyComponent is valid.
        Returns:
        true if this PolicyComponent is valid, else false.
